Can you provide steps that reproduce this problem?

Your workspace state on disk is corrupt.  Any idea how you might have gotten
into this state?  Some possiblities: Eclipse/VM crash during shutdown, out of
disk errors... Did anything major go wrong last time you shutdown?  Does the log
file have any information from a previous session that looks related?

i doubt the disk is corrupted, it's a fairly new machine that hasn't been 
terribly flakey (given windows xp and all).  i'm new to the ide, so perhaps i 
was doing something terribly unusual while in the 'getting to know you' 
period.  duno.  i've redone my installation, unfortunately, so i cant recreate 
the problem.  i'm going to attempt to recreate my environment with the latest 
rev(2.0.2), if this issue surfaces again, i'll make sure to update this post 
with more information.  

i do recall that my computer suffered a hostile shutdown over the weekend 
while my eclipse session was running, it also might have had an 
active 'connection' to the cvs server at the time, also, some of the source 
directories for my code were located on samba mounted drives that were not 
reestablished at reboot time (which i could see might have caused a problem or 
two, maybe?).  i was able to restart at least once successfully, tho after 
this event.  

i'll keep better track of my system once my environment is reestablished and 
update this post with whatever i can find.  i do sincerely love this ide, i'm 
coming from ibm's VAJ but feel your system is by far superior.  thanks! ant
Please reopen this bug report if the problem recurs.
